result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Madden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution from this case and Read in List, to be paid as a condition of probation before costs and fines.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Inform agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Consecutive to: Count 1 and any other sentence.

Defendant Michael J Madden in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for motion to stay sentence pending appeal.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding such request.  Court will stay remainder of sentence on Count #3, pending appeal.  Defendant is still required to sign up for probation forthwith for Counts #1 & 2.

IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief is extended to October 12, 2015.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to act under either WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(e) or (f) commences as of the date of this order.

Defendant Michael J Madden in court with Attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Theresa Williams, postal agent, makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fragoso makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Katelyn P. makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME    *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNTS #2 & 3 AND ANY OTHER SENTENCE*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribedsign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

RESTITUTION:  $155.00    - $100.00 on read-in case and $55.00 on this case (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $253.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #2:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 MONTHS JAIL STRAIGHT TIME    *CONSECUTIVE TO COUNTS #1 & 3 AND ANY OTHER SENTENCE*

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribedsign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation)


COUNT #3:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:

5 MONTHS HUBER  -  Defendant to report to jail on 9/17/15 by 8:00 p.m. 

COSTS:  $243.00  (to be paid as a condition of probation - probation on Counts #1 & 2)
